----------

Help! I found a crayon in my washer, but after it left purple marks over
several things. And, after the clothes went through the dryer. Any ideas?
There is too much to rub each spot out.
Help! I'm leaving on a trip the day after tomorrow.
Thanks,
Ann

messages.subject: Re: Off Topic....Crayons in Laundry
messages.msgSnippet: You can put a towel over the area and another under, and then use the hottest iron for the cloth and it should lift the crayon out. It depends on the type of
messages.messageBody:
You can put a towel over the area and another under, and then use the
hottest iron for the cloth and it should lift the crayon out. It depends
on the type of crayon, though, if you will be able to get the color
stain out, Crayolas usually come out pretty easily (yes, I've had this
experience before!!;)

Good luck,

Lisa F
